meanings.definition: To give a portion or share of something
meanings.sent1: She was imparting her knowledge to the students.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was imparting wisdom to the class.
meanings.sent3: The magician was imparting his secrets to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The sun was imparting warmth to the chilly morning.
meanings.sent5: The chef was imparting flavor to the dish with his special spices.

meanings.sent1: He was imparting the news to his friend.
meanings.sent2: The speaker was imparting important information to the audience.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was imparting messages to its owner in a funny voice.
meanings.sent4: The painting was imparting a sense of peace to the room.
meanings.sent5: The storyteller was imparting magic to the children with her tales.

meanings.sent1: The king was imparting titles to his loyal subjects.
meanings.sent2: The fairy godmother was imparting wishes to the protagonist.
meanings.sent3: The generous donor was imparting funds to the charity.
meanings.sent4: The artist was imparting beauty to the canvas with each stroke.
meanings.sent5: The mentor was imparting valuable advice to the mentee.
